intro: Celtis tala var. chichape, commonly known as the Chichape hackberry, is a small to medium-sized tree native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Elm family (Ulmaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, followed by small, spherical fruits that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in forested areas.
